title: Ticket #1760: privsep chown operation fails on unwritable directories
description:
We recently had a user that had a non-empty, non-writeable directory in their tarball. The job would run to completion but then when it was ending it would fail with this in the user pool job.log: 

007 (13028201.000.000) 10/21 13:37:09 Shadow exception!
Error from glidein_3025@fcdfcaf1492.fnal.gov: error changing sandbox
ownership to condor
0 - Run Bytes Sent By Job
14216253 - Run Bytes Received By Job

We are currently running: 

[cdfcaf@fcdfhead40dev ~] condor_version
$CondorVersion: 7.4.3 Aug 4 2010 BuildID: 261829 $
$CondorPlatform: X86_64-LINUX_RHEL5 $

The same problem occurred in 7.2.x also because we only recently upgraded but this issue first arose a while back and I'm only just getting to it.

The failure mode is very nasty because since it's an infrastructure failure, the job goes into a restart loop AFTER it has already fully run. This can cause lots of cpu to be wasted if it isn't noticed.
